name: GetTeamMembers
description:
Retrieve details of members in a specific team.

This tool fetches information about the members of a specific team, which includes users and escalation policies within an organization. It should be used when you need to access the list of users associated with a team. Requires OAuth scope: `teams.read`.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team whose members are being retrieved.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Versioning header used for specifying the version of the API to use.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: response_content_type
parameters.description: The desired content type for the response. Set to 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to return per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The starting point for pagination in search results. Useful for navigating through large sets of data.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: include_additional_models
parameters.description: Include additional models such as 'users' in the response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total number of results in the response, enhancing pagination metrics.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: total

By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.
